intro: Conostylis harperiana, commonly known as the Harper's conostylis, is a perennial herb native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of small, spike-like clusters of pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring. Conostylis harperiana is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
